storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to synchronize employee personal data daily to achieve up-to-date records

testCases.title: Validate successful daily synchronization of employee data
preconditions: HR system API is accessible and operational
API authentication credentials are configured correctly
Scheduled synchronization job is configured for daily execution
Test employee data exists in HR system with all mandatory fields populated
Network connectivity between systems is stable
Database has sufficient storage for employee records

steps.action: Trigger the scheduled synchronization job manually or wait for scheduled execution time
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization job starts successfully and initiates connection to HR system API /employees endpoint

steps.action: Monitor the synchronization process through system logs or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Employee data is retrieved from HR system API successfully with HTTP 200 status code

steps.action: Wait for the synchronization process to complete
steps.expectedResult: All employee records are processed and updated in the new platform database without errors

steps.action: Verify updated records in the new platform by querying the employee database or viewing through UI
steps.expectedResult: Employee records in the new platform reflect the latest data from HR system including all personal information fields

steps.action: Compare sample employee records between HR system and new platform
steps.expectedResult: Data matches exactly between both systems for all mandatory and optional fields

steps.action: Check synchronization logs in the system log files or monitoring dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Logs show successful completion status with no errors recorded

steps.action: Verify the total synchronization completion time in the logs
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization completed within 30 minutes SLA requirement

steps.action: Check the synchronization summary report for record counts
steps.expectedResult: Summary shows total records processed, records updated, records created, and 99.9% or higher success rate

postconditions: All employee records are synchronized successfully
New platform database contains up-to-date employee information
Synchronization logs are stored with timestamp and status
No error notifications sent to HR team
System is ready for next scheduled synchronization

testCases.title: Verify handling of incomplete employee data
preconditions: HR system API is accessible and operational
API authentication credentials are configured correctly
Test environment has ability to simulate incomplete employee data
Mandatory field validation rules are configured in the system
At least one employee record in HR system has missing mandatory fields
Synchronization job is ready to execute

steps.action: Prepare test data in HR system with employee records missing mandatory fields (e.g., employee ID, first name, last name, or email)
steps.expectedResult: Test employee records exist in HR system with one or more mandatory fields empty or null

steps.action: Trigger the synchronization job to process employee data including incomplete records
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization job starts and begins retrieving employee data from HR system API

steps.action: Monitor the synchronization process as it encounters incomplete employee records
steps.expectedResult: System detects missing mandatory fields during validation phase

steps.action: Check synchronization logs for error entries related to incomplete records
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization logs contain specific error messages identifying which records have missing mandatory fields and which fields are missing

steps.action: Verify that incomplete records are not updated in the new platform database
steps.expectedResult: Incomplete employee records are not created or updated in the new platform; existing records remain unchanged

steps.action: Confirm that synchronization continues processing remaining valid records after encountering incomplete data
steps.expectedResult: System skips incomplete records and successfully processes all valid employee records without stopping the entire synchronization

steps.action: Review the synchronization summary report
steps.expectedResult: Report shows total records processed, number of successful updates, and number of failed records with reasons

steps.action: Verify that error notifications are sent to HR team
steps.expectedResult: HR team receives error report listing all incomplete records with details of missing mandatory fields

postconditions: Valid employee records are synchronized successfully
Incomplete records are not updated in the new platform
Error logs contain detailed information about incomplete records
HR team is notified of data quality issues
System maintains data integrity by rejecting incomplete records

storyTitle: As HR Analyst, I want to manually trigger employee data synchronization to achieve immediate updates

testCases.title: Verify authorized user can trigger manual sync
preconditions: HR system API is accessible and operational
Manual synchronization feature is deployed and configured
Test user account with HR Analyst role exists in the system
User has valid credentials for login
Role-based access control is properly configured
Synchronization page is accessible in the application
Employee data exists in HR system for synchronization

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid credentials for authorized HR Analyst user and click login button
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the application dashboard

steps.action: Verify access to synchronization page by navigating to the HR synchronization section
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization page is accessible and displays the 'Sync Now' button without access denied errors

steps.action: Review the synchronization page interface for current sync status
steps.expectedResult: Page displays last synchronization timestamp, status, and the enabled 'Sync Now' button

steps.action: Click the 'Sync Now' button to trigger manual synchronization
steps.expectedResult: System initiates manual synchronization process and displays a progress indicator or status message

steps.action: Monitor the synchronization status displayed on the page
steps.expectedResult: Status updates in real-time showing 'In Progress' or similar message with progress information

steps.action: Wait for synchronization to complete and observe the final status
steps.expectedResult: Status changes to 'Completed' or 'Success' with summary of records processed, updated, and any errors

steps.action: Verify synchronization results displayed to the user
steps.expectedResult: Results show total records synchronized, completion time, and success/failure counts

steps.action: Navigate to system logs or audit trail section
steps.expectedResult: Logs section is accessible and displays recent synchronization events

steps.action: Check logs for the manual sync event entry
steps.expectedResult: Event is logged with event type 'Manual Sync', correct username of the HR Analyst, accurate timestamp, and completion status

steps.action: Verify the timestamp in the log matches the time when 'Sync Now' was clicked
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is accurate within acceptable margin (few seconds) of when the button was clicked

postconditions: Manual synchronization completed successfully
Employee data is updated in the new platform
Synchronization event is logged with user details and timestamp
User remains logged in and can perform additional actions
System is ready for next synchronization request

testCases.title: Verify unauthorized user cannot trigger manual sync
preconditions: Manual synchronization feature is deployed with role-based access control
Test user account without HR Analyst role exists (e.g., regular employee or different department user)
User has valid credentials for login but lacks HR synchronization permissions
API endpoint /api/hr/sync/manual is protected with authorization checks
Security policies are properly configured

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page
steps.expectedResult: Login page is displayed with username and password fields

steps.action: Enter valid credentials for non-HR user (unauthorized user) and click login button
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the application dashboard appropriate for their role

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the synchronization page through the application menu or direct URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message such as 'Access Denied', '403 Forbidden', or 'You do not have permission to access this page'

steps.action: Verify that synchronization page or 'Sync Now' button is not visible in the user interface
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization menu option is hidden or disabled for unauthorized user role

steps.action: Open API testing tool (e.g., Postman, curl) and prepare a request to /api/hr/sync/manual endpoint
steps.expectedResult: API testing tool is ready with the manual sync endpoint URL configured

steps.action: Include the unauthorized user's authentication token in the API request headers
steps.expectedResult: Request is properly formatted with valid authentication token for non-HR user

steps.action: Send POST request to /api/hr/sync/manual endpoint
steps.expectedResult: API request is transmitted to the server

steps.action: Review the API response status code and message
steps.expectedResult: Request is rejected with HTTP 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized status code and error message indicating insufficient permissions or authorization failure

steps.action: Verify the error response body contains appropriate authorization error details
steps.expectedResult: Response body includes error message such as 'User does not have required role for this operation' or 'Authorization failed'

steps.action: Check system logs for the unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Security logs record the failed authorization attempt with user details, timestamp, and reason for denial

steps.action: Verify that no synchronization was triggered by the unauthorized request
steps.expectedResult: No synchronization event is logged and employee data remains unchanged

postconditions: Unauthorized user cannot access synchronization functionality
No manual synchronization was executed
Security logs contain record of unauthorized access attempt
System security and data integrity maintained
User remains logged in with their authorized access level

storyTitle: As Integration Engineer, I want to detect and log data conflicts during HR synchronization to achieve data integrity

testCases.title: Verify detection and logging of data conflicts
preconditions: HR synchronization system is operational and accessible
API endpoint /api/hr/sync is available and responding
Test employee records exist in both source HR system and target database
Conflicting employee data is prepared in source system (e.g., different job title, department, or salary for same employee ID)
Log access permissions are configured for test user
Notification system is configured and support team contact details are set up
Database connection to local database is established

steps.action: Prepare conflicting employee data by modifying an existing employee record in the source HR system with different values for key fields (e.g., Employee ID: EMP001, Name: John Doe, Department changed from 'IT' to 'Finance', Salary changed from 75000 to 85000) while keeping the same employee in target database with original values
steps.expectedResult: Source HR system contains employee record with updated values that differ from target database record for the same employee ID

steps.action: Trigger the HR synchronization job manually or wait for scheduled synchronization to run via /api/hr/sync endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization job initiates successfully and begins processing employee records

steps.action: Monitor the synchronization process as the system compares incoming data from source HR system with existing records in target database
steps.expectedResult: System performs field-level comparison between source and target records for employee EMP001

steps.action: Observe system behavior when conflict is encountered for employee EMP001
steps.expectedResult: System detects data conflict for key fields (Department and Salary mismatch) and flags the record for conflict logging

steps.action: Access the conflict log file or database table to verify conflict details are recorded
steps.expectedResult: Conflict log entry contains: Employee ID (EMP001), conflicting field names (Department, Salary), source values (Finance, 85000), target values (IT, 75000), timestamp of detection, and conflict severity level

steps.action: Check the notification system (email, messaging platform, or notification dashboard) for conflict alerts sent to support team
steps.expectedResult: Support team receives notification within 5 minutes containing conflict summary, affected employee ID, conflicting fields, and link to detailed log entry

steps.action: Verify the timestamp in the conflict log matches the actual time of synchronization run
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp in conflict log is accurate and corresponds to when the synchronization job detected the conflict

steps.action: Confirm that the conflicting record was not automatically overwritten in the target database
steps.expectedResult: Target database still contains original values (Department: IT, Salary: 75000) for employee EMP001, data integrity is maintained

postconditions: Conflict is logged in the system with complete details
Support team has received notification about the conflict
Conflicting employee record remains unchanged in target database
Conflict log is accessible for troubleshooting and resolution
System is ready for next synchronization cycle

testCases.title: Verify synchronization continues for non-conflicting data
preconditions: HR synchronization system is operational and accessible
API endpoint /api/hr/sync is available and responding
Test dataset contains a mix of employee records: at least 2 conflicting records and at least 3 non-conflicting records
Conflicting records have mismatched key field values between source and target
Non-conflicting records have matching data or are new records to be inserted
Database connection to local database is established
Sufficient database storage and system resources are available
Notification system is configured for conflict alerts

steps.action: Prepare test dataset with 5 employee records: Record 1 (EMP001) - conflicting Department field, Record 2 (EMP002) - conflicting Salary field, Record 3 (EMP003) - non-conflicting update to phone number, Record 4 (EMP004) - non-conflicting new employee, Record 5 (EMP005) - non-conflicting update to address
steps.expectedResult: Test dataset is ready with 2 conflicting and 3 non-conflicting employee records in source HR system

steps.action: Initiate the HR synchronization job via /api/hr/sync endpoint
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization job starts and begins processing all 5 employee records from source system

steps.action: Monitor synchronization progress as system processes the mixed dataset
steps.expectedResult: System processes each record sequentially, performing field-level comparisons for existing records and identifying new records

steps.action: Observe system behavior when first conflicting record (EMP001) is encountered
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict for EMP001, logs the conflict details, and continues processing remaining records without stopping the synchronization job

steps.action: Observe system behavior when first non-conflicting record (EMP003) is processed
steps.expectedResult: System successfully updates phone number for EMP003 in target database without any errors or conflicts

steps.action: Observe system behavior when second conflicting record (EMP002) is encountered
steps.expectedResult: System detects conflict for EMP002, logs the conflict details, and continues processing remaining records

steps.action: Observe system behavior when new employee record (EMP004) is processed
steps.expectedResult: System successfully inserts new employee EMP004 into target database with all field values from source system

steps.action: Observe system behavior when final non-conflicting record (EMP005) is processed
steps.expectedResult: System successfully updates address for EMP005 in target database

steps.action: Wait for synchronization job to complete and verify completion status
steps.expectedResult: Synchronization job completes successfully within 5 minutes with status indicating partial success (3 records updated/inserted, 2 conflicts detected)

steps.action: Query target database to verify non-conflicting records (EMP003, EMP004, EMP005) were updated/inserted correctly
steps.expectedResult: EMP003 shows updated phone number, EMP004 exists as new record with all correct values, EMP005 shows updated address in target database

steps.action: Query target database to verify conflicting records (EMP001, EMP002) were not overwritten
steps.expectedResult: EMP001 and EMP002 retain their original values in target database, no data corruption occurred

steps.action: Review conflict logs to confirm both conflicts were logged
steps.expectedResult: Conflict log contains 2 entries with details for EMP001 and EMP002, including timestamps and field-level conflict information

steps.action: Check notification system for alerts sent to support team
steps.expectedResult: Support team received notifications for both conflicts (EMP001 and EMP002) within 5 minutes of detection

postconditions: Synchronization job completed successfully for non-conflicting records
3 non-conflicting employee records (EMP003, EMP004, EMP005) are updated/inserted in target database
2 conflicting employee records (EMP001, EMP002) remain unchanged in target database
All conflicts are logged with complete details
Support team has been notified of all conflicts
System is ready for conflict resolution and next synchronization cycle
Data integrity is maintained across all records
